column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=That is what you consider the greatest threat to humanity ?
#Text=Yes , any fundamentalist fanaticism is a vast threat .
#Text=I ’m looking for humanity to have a secular , pluralistic culture .

#Text=People should be able to follow whatever fantasies or religions they want , as long as they do n't impose them on other people and force other people into doing things based upon whatever kind of holy writ they have .
#Text=So the biggest threat to that are these fundamentalists who want to force people into their belief systems .
#Text=They want to destroy people who have sexual activity they do n't think is appropriate according to their texts .

#Text=It will be interesting to see in the future if people will wake up to this threat and decide to somehow corral that kind of behavior , defang people like that who are basically on a jihad , whether they be Christians or Muslims or any other religion , because we ’ve seen in the past the Catholics were torturing people to death in the Inquisition , then the Reformation happened and different denominations and sects were killing each other .
#Text=Heretics were being slaughtered .
#Text=So this is not something just one religion is guilty of .
#Text=On New York City
#Text=How do you feel about Hell 's Kitchen , where you live , being called Clinton ?
#Text=I despise that .
#Text=It should stick to what it really is , and it ’s Hell ’s Kitchen .
#Text=When you see how New York is changing around you — I ’ve lived here for close to seven years , and even when I moved here it was very different .
#Text=I like the sleaze , I like the history , I like to see New York being this amazing range of the highest and the lowest and I do n't think New York should be cleaned up and Disneyfied .
#Text=But it is .
#Text=It ’s getting there .
#Text=I did a Black Mass for the BBC in the old Hellfire Club , and that ’s gone and Apple is putting up a store in that neighborhood . [ Laughs ]
#Text=Everybody just feels safe walking around all the time now .
#Text=There ’s still some parts of Chinatown that are still pretty rough .
#Text=Where do you think the culture is going to go ?
#Text=Is the sanitized version here to stay ?
#Text=No , because if you look at anything that at one point is sleazy , at one it was new and spiffy and wonderful .
#Text=So , at this point , New York is Manhattanland , it 's for tourists and we ’ve made this almost Las Vegas simulacrum of the whole thing .
#Text=But it will change .
#Text=As soon as the money is n't worth pumping into it to keep up the façade , all of the roughness around the edges will creep back in .
#Text=It ’s still here , it just hides in the daytime .
#Text=There ’s still all kinds of weird crime going on in the city when you watch the news .
